attributes.action: Allow graduates to offset their student loan payments against income tax deductions
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
After completing a higher education course, the average student is expected to leave with over £20,000 of debt.  With many contributors including increasing tuition fees, living expenses I propose that graduates should be given the opportunity to offset their student loan repayments against their income tax for a maximum period.  As a minimum this should at least cover the monthly interest.

This would allow a period where graduates could see their debt reducing, and potentially increase contributions to the British economy and allow them to enter the housing market.
